page.title: 01Brigstock
page.content: Brigstock is a large village,8 miles north east of Kettering. The A6116 road goes from Corby to Thrapston. This road has recently been improved.North of this road is reclaimed land, either mixed wood or farmland.Just before the village on the south side there are some boarding kennels for dogs, gun dogs are also trained here. The population of Brigstock is approx 1137, the buildings are a mixture of old and new. There are many thatched cottages and the road through the village is narrow and twisting. (A new bypass is planned).To the north of Brigstock is {Fermyn Woods Hall}and to the east a newly developed{Country Park.}There are three farms in the area. Formerly this area was part of the{Royal {Hunting Park }of {Rockingham Forest.
